title: Pakistan upstage Sri Lanka in first ODI as Agha and Rauf shine
byline: Pakistan rode on a fighting century from Salman Agha and four wickets from Haris Rauf to beat Sri Lanka by six runs in the opening one-day international in Rawalpindi on Tuesday.

title: Ronaldo confirms 2026 World Cup will be his last
byline: Portugal striker Cristiano Ronaldo has confirmed the 2026 World Cup will be his last.

title: All you need to know about the 2025 Ashes
byline: The Ashes between Australia and England gets under way on 21 November down under.

title: Most local bodies default on street lamp electricity payments: Minister
byline: Minister of Power and Energy Kumara Jayakody told Parliament today that almost all local authorities, including the Colombo Municipal Council, have defaulted on paying electricity bills for street lamps.

title: 1,000 Sri Lankan children await heart surgery
byline: More than 1,000 children in Sri Lanka are currently on waiting lists for life-saving heart surgeries but a new partnership between the Ministry of Health and the Rotary Club of Colombo West aims to bring hope to some of them.

title: Former land ministers distributed state lands among relatives – Deputy Minister
byline: Deputy Minister Aravinda Senarath told Parliament today that several former ministers who previously oversaw the Land Ministry had distributed state lands among their family members and relatives.

title: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga arrested
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga was arrested this morning (12) after appearing before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption.

title: Prasanna Ranatunga arrives at Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister Prasanna Ranatunga appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) a short while ago to provide a statement.

title: Global girl group Katseye have received ’thousands’ of death threats
byline: The girl group Katseye say they have received multiple online death threats since they made their debut last year.

title: New chairman appointed to Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha
byline: Sameera Danushka de Silva from the Samagi Jana Balavegaya (SJB) has been gazetted as the new Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha, filling the vacancy created by the death of former Chairman Lasantha Wickramasekera.

title: Turkish military cargo plane crashes with at least 20 on board
byline: A Turkish military cargo plane carrying at least 20 people has crashed near the Azerbaijan-Georgia border, Turkey’s defence ministry has said.

title: President’s budgetary proposal deemed unlawful - COPF
byline: The government is heading for trouble over the budget proposal to pay Rs.200 as a daily allowance for estate workers since such state revenue cannot be used to make payments for those employed by the private sector.

title: No security threat to Sri Lanka after explosions in India, Pakistan – Minister
byline: Minister of Public Security Ananda Wijepala has assured that there is no security threat to Sri Lanka in the wake of the recent explosions reported in India and Pakistan.

title: Protesters break into COP30 venue in Brazil
byline: Protesters carrying signs reading ’’our forests are not for sale’’ broke through security lines of the COP30 climate talks on Tuesday night in Belém, Brazil.

title: You blocked then , you build now, Namal tells Govt
byline: Delivering remarks during the budget debate, Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer and MP Namal Rajapaksa drew attention to the stark policy contrasts between the present government and its earlier positions when in opposition.

title: New Zealand to open applications for two new seasonal work visas in December
byline: The Government of New Zealand has announced that applications for two new seasonal visa categories will open on 8 December 2025, offering more opportunities for overseas workers during peak employment periods.

title: 25 specialists leave annually, hospitals under strain: Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa says
byline: Sri Lanka’s healthcare system is grappling with a growing shortage of specialist doctors, as around 25 leave the country each year, severely impacting hospitals across the island, warns Specialist Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa, Chairman of the Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance.

title: Tamim Rahman indicted over LPL fixing bid, ready to admit guilt
byline: The Attorney General today filed indictments before Colombo High Court Judge Udesh Ranatunga against Tamim Rahman, the owner of the Dambulla Thunders cricket team, who is accused of attempting to influence a player participating in last year’s Lanka Premier League (LPL) to fix a match.

title: World Bank grants misused: Minister
byline: Funds provided by the World Bank for entrepreneur development have been misused and given to relatives of former Ministers, Minister Samantha Vidyaratne told Parliament today.

title: Ravi questions legality of 2022 debt default
byline: Former Finance Minister and MP Ravi Karunanayake has questioned the legality and accountability of Sri Lanka’s 2022 decision to suspend repayment of its external debt, calling on Prime Minister Anura Kumara Dissanayake to clarify whether the move was made without parliamentary sanction

title: SLPP MPs refuse official vehicles
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said he and his fellow SLPP MPs do not require the official cab vehicles allocated to them and have decided to hand over all three vehicles to the Ministry of Health.

title: Bus driver remanded over fatal Thalawa accident
byline: The bus driver involved in the Thalawa Jayagaha accident has been remanded until November 18.

title: Colombo Mayor walks with vision-impaired group
byline: Colombo Mayor Vraîe Cally Balthazaar yesterday (11) joined a group of vision-impaired individuals to raise awareness about the daily challenges they face in navigating the city.

title: Apple to sell $230 iPhone pocket this week
byline: Apple has partnered with Japanese luxury fashion house Issey Miyake to launch a 3D-knitted carrying bag for the iPhone that resembles a sock, a limited-edition accessory inspired by minimalist design.

title: NPP MP files complaint over false drug trafficking claims
byline: National People’s Power (NPP) MP Chaminda Lalith Kumara has lodged a complaint with the Mirigama Police against social media posts alleging that he is involved in drug trafficking.

title: 5,000 coconut trees to be destroyed to contain root wilt disease
byline: The Coconut Cultivation Board (CCB) has decided to cut down and destroy around 5,000 coconut trees in the Matara District due to the rapid spread of the coconut root wilt disease, locally known as ’Weligama Wint’.

title: President condoles victims of Islamabad attack
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake expressed deep sorrow over the attack in Islamabad yesterday, extending his heartfelt condolences to the families of the victims and wishing the injured a speedy recovery.

title: President calls for swift implementation of Unique Digital Identity project
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has emphasized the need to expedite the Sri Lanka Unique Digital Identity (SLUDI) project and strengthen the nation’s overall digital economy framework to accelerate the country’s transformation into a modern, tech-driven economy.

title: Birth certificates to be delivered via post under new project
byline: Sri Lanka today launched a pilot project to deliver national birth certificates directly to citizens through the Sri Lanka Postal Courier Service, the Department of Registrar General announced.

title: Prasanna Ranatunga released on bail
byline: Former Minister of Tourism and Aviation Prasanna Ranatunga, who was arrested today by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption, was released on bail by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama.

title: New political movement ‘Bahujana Balaya’ launched
byline: A new political movement named Bahujana Balaya (People’s Power) was launched on Tuesday with the aim of uniting young leaders from across the political spectrum to promote citizen-centered governance.

title: Trump says United States doesn’t have talented people to fill jobs domestically
byline: President Donald Trump told Fox News in an interview that aired Tuesday night the United States doesn’t have talented workers to fill jobs needed domestically, defending the H1-B skilled worker visa program.

title: Sri Lanka targets high-spending Luxembourgers for tourism
byline: The Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau (SLTPB) in collaboration with the Sri Lanka Embassy in Brussels, Belgium, which is also accredited to Luxembourg, successfully organised a Sri Lanka Tourism Roadshow on 23 October 2025 in Luxembourg.

title: Will give farmers higher prices for onion, potatoes but consumers should bear the cost: Lalkantha
byline: Agriculture Minister K.D. Lalkantha, commenting on the crisis faced by potato and onion growers, said the government will ensure maximum support prices for them next time, but admitted that such a move would inevitably lead to retail price hikes, leaving consumers in the lurch.

title: Street dog population in Sri Lanka rises to over 2 million: Animal Welfare Association
byline: The Sri Lanka Animal Welfare Association has warned that the number of street dogs in the country has increased to between two and three million.

title: Jesus did not appear on hill in France, Vatican says
byline: Jesus may answer prayers but he has not made special appearances in a small town in the north of France, the Vatican said on Wednesday.

title: ASPI extends uptrend amid volatile trading and strong earnings momentum
byline: Colombo, 12th November 2025 – The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) sustained its positive momentum, closing higher despite a volatile trading session. The ASPI surged over 187 points during early trading, driven by strong investor optimism, before easing in the latter half to settle with a 77-point gain, maintaining its upward trajectory.

title: Comet similar to interstellar object 3I/ATLAS fast moving towards earth
byline: Astronomers have observed a mysterious comet racing through the solar system towards both Earth and the Sun. It has led to comparisons with the famous interstellar object 3I/ATLAS.

title: Charges against Daisy Forrest cannot be maintained due to dementia: Defense tells court
byline: Defense counsel representing Daisy Forrest, the grandmother of Yoshitha Rajapaksa, informed the Colombo High Court that maintaining proceedings against her under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act is baseless, as she is suffering from dementia.

title: Met Dept warns of thundershowers and severe lightning in several areas
byline: The Meteorology Department has warned that thundershowers accompanied by severe lightning are likely to occur in the Southern and Uva Provinces, as well as in the Kalutara, Rathnapura, and Ampara districts.

title: Sri Lankan players touring Pakistan raise safety concerns; seek to return home
byline: Several Sri Lankan cricket players touring Pakistan have sought permission to return home, expressing concern for their safety following a bomb blast in Islamabad.

title: SJB still undecided on attending Nugegoda rally
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) is still undecided on attending the Nugegoda rally on November 21, party General Secretary Ranjith Madduma Bandara said today.

title: Nugegoda rally will highlight govt promises: Namal says
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Parliamentarian Namal Rajapaksa said the upcoming anti-government rally in Nugegoda on November 21 aims to remind the government of the promises it made to the people.

title: Why Montessori teachers failed to do it: Minister responds to Sajith on state revenue collection
byline: Refuting claims of opposition leader Sajith Premadasa that the government has collected record state revenue by overly taxing people, Minister Anura Karunathilake said no new tax was imposed in 2025 and that state revenue was collected due to proper management of existing taxes and by strengthening the tax net.

title: SLPP, UNP discuss upcoming Nugegoda rally
byline: Several Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) representatives held a special discussion with United National Party (UNP) leaders regarding the anti-government rally scheduled to be held in Nugegoda on November 21.

title: World oil and gas demand could grow until 2050, IEA says
byline: Global oil and gas demand could grow until 2050, the International Energy Agency said on Wednesday, departing from previous expectations of a speedy transition to cleaner fuels following U.S. criticism about its climate focus.

title: Los Angeles 2028 Olympic Games schedule revealed
byline: The 2028 Los Angeles Olympics competition schedule was unveiled on Wednesday by organizers, including a showcase spot for the women’s 100 meters and a Super Saturday session.

title: Wolves appoint ex-defender Edwards as manager
byline: Wolves have appointed Rob Edwards as their new manager on a three-and-a-half-year contract following the sacking of Vitor Pereira.

title: Muthusamy and Wolvaardt named ICC Players of the Month for October
byline: All-rounder Senuran Muthusamy’s outstanding performances with bat and ball in Test cricket and captain Laura Wolvaardt’s superb efforts as opening bat in the ICC Women’s Cricket World Cup 2025 have helped them win the ICC Player of the Month awards for October 2025.
